intro: Crassula sieberiana subsp. rubinea, commonly known as the red crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, rounded rosettes of fleshy, dark green leaves with a reddish tint, especially under bright light. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the warmer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil with plenty of sunlight. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections.
